intro: Achillea boissieri, commonly known as the Armenian yarrow, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring finely divided, silver-gray leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its medicinal properties have been historically valued for their anti-inflammatory and astringent effects. Achillea boissieri is often found in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun.
